meanings.definition: The property of an electric circuit by which a change in current induces an electromotive force.
meanings.sent1: The inductance of the coil caused a magnetic field to form around it.
meanings.sent2: The inductance in the circuit slowed down the flow of electricity.
meanings.sent3: The inductance of the wire was so strong that it seemed to pull nearby objects towards it.
meanings.sent4: Her inductance towards learning new things was like a magnet, attracting knowledge effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The inductance of the transformer was so powerful that it could light up the entire room with a single spark.

meanings.definition: The act or process of introducing someone into a new job, position, or organization.
meanings.sent1: The inductance of the new employee into the team was smooth and welcoming.
meanings.sent2: The inductance of the intern into the company culture was seamless.
meanings.sent3: The inductance of the CEO into the company picnic was unexpected but delightful.
meanings.sent4: Her inductance into the book club was like a breath of fresh air, bringing new perspectives.
meanings.sent5: The inductance of the new member into the band brought a wave of enthusiasm and energy.
